Double‐sigmoidal NLS fit (with baseline h0)

Source: R/doublesigmoidalFitFunctions_h0.R
sigFit2.Rd

Fits `doubleSigmoidalFitFormula_h0()` to a `data.frame(time, intensity)` via `minpack.lm::nlsLM()`, appending h0 and AIC/BIC.

Usage

sigFit2(
  dataInput,
  tryCounter,
  startList = list(finalAsymptoteIntensityRatio = 0.5, maximum = 1, slope1Param = 1,
    midPoint1Param = 0.33, slope2Param = 1, midPointDistanceParam = 0.29, h0 = 0.1),
  lowerBounds = c(finalAsymptoteIntensityRatio = 0, maximum = 0.3, slope1Param = 0.01,
    midPoint1Param = -0.52, slope2Param = 0.01, midPointDistanceParam = 0.04, h0 = 0),
  upperBounds = c(finalAsymptoteIntensityRatio = 1.5, maximum = 1.5, slope1Param = 180,
    midPoint1Param = 1.15, slope2Param = 180, midPointDistanceParam = 0.63, h0 = 0.3),
  min_Factor = 1/2^20,
  n_iterations = 1000
)

Arguments

dataInput

data.frame or list with `$timeIntensityData`.

tryCounter

Integer: which random‐start iteration this is.

startList

Named list of starting values (including h0).

lowerBounds

Named vector of lower bounds.

upperBounds

Named vector of upper bounds.

min_Factor

Passed to `nlsLM()`.

n_iterations

Max iterations for `nlsLM()`.

Value

A one‐row data.frame of estimates, fit‐statistics, and `h0_Estimate`.

On this page
